data.text: @ASFSPAIN Since 2013, we have been collaborating with the vaccination projects carried out by @unicef_es and, with the support of IAG Cargo, we have been sending supplies to respond to the emergency in Haiti (3/4) ⬇️ https://t.co/7BumX2vo33
The volunteers at @ASFSPAIN are mainly people working in the aviation sector. They accompany those in need on their trips and help to take humanitarian aid (2/4) ⬇️ https://t.co/nHNhNISfQc

Today is #WorldNGODay and we want to talk about the work carried out by three inspiring charities. We collaborate with these three organisations so we can make a difference wherever we fly. We'd love you to find out more about them! 🌎 (1/4) ⬇️

✈️  Welcome A350 Hola, Madrid. We are excited with the arrival in our fleet of these new airplanes that will allow us to fly high towards recovery 👏🏻
https://t.co/af6ZfSSdiH

urls.title: Ministerio de Sanidad, Consumo y Bienestar Social - Professionals - Travel and COVID-19
urls.description: Travel and COVID-19, Ministerio de Sanidad, Consumo y Bienestar Social

data.text: 📢📢 Restrictions update! Starting from today, June the 7th, some restrictions are lifted to enter Spain as a tourist. Please check out all the details at the following link: https://t.co/aNKbh58SFJ
📱 In all cases, the QR is mandatory after filling in the entry form at https://t.co/5lc3kcmkdu, including passengers in transit

Safe list: Australia, Israel, Japan, New Zealand, Rwanda, Singapore, South Korea, Thailand, United Kingdom, China and the special administrative regions of Hong Kong and Macao - this list will be reviewed by the authorities every week
📌 If you come from other countries, you may only enter with a vaccination certificate, except for countries on the safe list, which do not need to provide any additional documentation

📌 If you are traveling from an EU / Schengen country, you must provide a vaccination certificate, proof of recovery or negative PCR or antigen tests, carried out no more than 48 hours before the arrival of your flight.
❗️❗️ As of Monday, June 7, some restrictions are lifted to enter Spain as a tourist. Conditions vary depending on the origin of your trip.

data.text: Today on Earth Day 🌍, IAG has committed itself to the goal of operating 10% of their flights with sustainable fuel by 2030. ✈ It is the first airline group in Europe to make such a commitment, which will reduce carbon emissions by 2M T by 2030.

And our next destination is 🥁... Maldives 🎆
And another 112 routes that are "good news for the tourism sector and an example of how we at Iberia are adapting to current circumstances by opening up new markets". All the information 👇

Welcome to a new way of flying: the one that allows you to keep enjoying the Iberia Plus experience.
To thank you for your trust, we multiply your Elite Points and maintain your IB Plus level until March 2022. Because what’s normal is to fly with the same benefits as ever. https://t.co/Dl4ttXzQC8

data.text: Our facial recognition project at Madrid airport is evolving towards biometric identification with tablets, thereby improving the travel experience at the airport and eliminating any type of physical contact, which increases security in all airport procedures.

data.text: ⚠️Latest information on the snow storm in Madrid: customers flying into or out of Madrid should not proceed to Adolfo-Suárez Madrid-Barajas Airport. More info 👇
You may check your flight status on our website. We appreciate your patience, and ask you to only contact us by telephone in case of absolute necessity. Thank you very much.

If you have a scheduled flight, we will send you an alternative as soon as possible. We ask that you please update your contact information on  https://t.co/bxnYfQkdRb that we may inform you in case of any developments through our Iberia Conecta service.

Due to adverse weather conditions, Madrid-Barajas Airport remains closed and suspends operations on Saturday the 9th until further notice. For your safety, we ask you kindly to not proceed to the airport.
